New Records: Ireland defeated Pakistan by 5 wickets in their first T-20 win over Pakistan, their first win over Pakistan since 2007 50-over World Cup.
Key Match Events: Craig Young took two crucial wickets in one over of Babar Azam and Azam Khan to put the Pakistan middle order under tremendous pressure.
Andrew Balbirnie and Harry Tector put on a 75-run partnership to take their side past the 100-run mark.
Balbirnie continued to play a counter-attacking innings (77 off 55 balls) to take his side close to the target before being dismissed by Shaheen Shah Afridi.
Curtis Campher took a leg bye off the penultimate ball of the match to seal a memorable victory for his side.
Post-Match Reflections: Netizens reacted to Ireland's historic win over Pakistan, with one user calling it the 'worst team ever'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's loss puts them 1-0 down in the three-match T20 series, ahead of the upcoming T20 World Cup.
The two teams will also face each other in the group stages of the T20 World Cup next month.
